alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 03 at 7:55PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 750 PM EST, The automated gauge on Duck Creek at Macksburg reported a stage of 14.09 feet. At stages between 13 and 15 feet, Broad Street starts to flood near the creek. Homes on the left bank start to flood, and the campground next to gauge floods. - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Despite the transition to freezing rain, runoff will continue to contribute to creeks rises through the evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macksburg and Lower Salem. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
